page.title: 15THE ELEANOR CROSS
page.content: Geddington is best known for its monument to Queen Eleanor, wife of Edward I. The Eleanor Cross was built in the centre of the village in 1294. Eleanor died in 1290 at Harby in Nottinghamshire whilst travelling to meet Edward I in Scotland. The cortege carrying Eleanor's body from Harby to Westminster completed the journey in a number of easy stages at each stopping point a monument later being erected. The 3 remaining crosses are at Geddington, Northampton and Waltham Cross. The Cross is triangular in plan and stands on a base of 7 steps. The clustered mouldings and roses of the first stage have been worn almost smooth but the whole monument, its statues and pinnacles is in good condition.
